greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table T(n,k) read by antidiagonals. T(n,k) is the number of primitive (=aperiodic) k-ary Lyndon words (n,k >= 1) with length less than or equal to n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 1..141, flattened
Index entries for sequences related to Lyndon words
example: T(3,2) = 5, because 5 words of length <=3 over 2-letter alphabet {a,b} are primitive Lyndon words: a, b, ab, aab, abb.
maple: f2:= proc(n) option remember; unapply(f0(n)(x)/n, x) end:
g2:= proc(n) option remember; unapply(add(f2(j)(x), j=1..n), x) end:
mathematica: f0[n_] := f0[n] = Function[k, k^n-Sum[f0[d][k], {d, Divisors[n]//Most}]]; f2[n_] := f2[n] = Function[x, f0[n][x]/n]; g2[n_] := g2[n] = Function[x, Sum[f2[j][x], {j, 1, n}]]; T[n_, k_] := g2[n][k]; Table[T[n, 1+d-n], {d, 1, 12}, {n, 1, d}]//Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 12 2014, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 07 2008
